Donate to Election Campaigns

Supporting candidates in key elections is one of the most effective ways to influence immigration policy and hold ICE accountable. Your donation can help elect leaders who will fight for immigrant rights and real reform. Research candidates and donate directly to their campaigns for maximum impact.

  • See competitive House races (Cook Political Report) – Nonpartisan analysis of the most competitive U.S. House races.
  • See competitive Senate races (Cook Political Report) – Nonpartisan analysis of the most competitive U.S. Senate races.
  • State and Local Election Alliance – focuses solely on non-federal offices, driving resources to where they’ll make the most impact and often at a fraction of the cost.

    Advocacy Organizations

    Support these organizations working for immigrant rights, legal aid, and social justice in Massachusetts and beyond:

    • MIRA Coalition (Massachusetts Immigrant & Refugee Advocacy Coalition)
    • LUCE (Lawyers for Civil Rights) – Massachusetts Hotline and Resource Hub
    • ACLU of Massachusetts
    • Indivisible MA
    • Indivisible LAB
    • Welcome Immigrant Network (WIN) – Mutual Aid & Emergency Support, Salem, MA
    • San Pedro Episcopal Church Discretionary Fund – Coats, diapers, and mutual aid for immigrants
    • BIJAN (Boston Immigrant Justice Accompaniment Network) – Bond Fund
    • BIJAN – Commissary Fund
    • Operation Milkweed – Emergency aid for community members in crisis
    • Supply Hub (Venmo: Barbara Roy, Lauren Noyes) – Printing, supplies, and materials for coalition
    • North Shore Sides With Love – Runs the supply hub in Salem
    • Contact: PajamaActivism@proton.me (coalition supply hub)
